channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024040947
item.description:
Report X-2024040947

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box: UN1789 containing (5 fiberboard boxes) was discovered leaking on the bottom. Inner contents: 5 fiberboard boxes smaller boxes. One of the inner boxes, which was leaking, had been packed upside down (indicated by the orientation arrows on each inner box. The contents of each inner box were 1 glass bottle, held in place with Styrofoam. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024040761
item.description:
Report X-2024040761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package was reported as damage because the box was wet, once the package was opened it was noted that the items of ethyl alcohol needed to be labeled as hazmat property, package was contained while having it process. DescribePack: one of the bottle seals was broken which contributed to the leakage. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: adding extra seals and plastic around the bottles, also ethyl alcohol is strong item for hazmat properties

item.title: Report X-2024040709
item.description:
Report X-2024040709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Strong odor of sulfur noticed around car by Mechanical person during inspection. Car isolated and NS Haz Mat & contractor responded. Meter reading of over 90ppm were found around the base of the "Salco" style rupture disk assembly. Rupture disk and gasket were removed and replaced. Car had a lot of pressure on it and had to vent through tthe disk assembly before removal. Once reassembled, still got hit on meter. Rupture disk assembly was removed from manway cover, gasket replaced, and assembly was resecured. No reading on meter.

item.title: Report E-2024040427
item.description:
Report E-2024040427

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, at 0844 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Ashland, Virginia regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons of BLUESKIN LVC ADHESIVE (UN1133, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon poly drum due to being punctured by a forklift. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a 5ft x 8ft area on the trailer floor and cardboard. Contractors were able to clean the release with a multi-purpose remover, absorbents, and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DM and was taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040387
item.description:
Report E-2024040387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: PORTSMOUTH
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was damaged due to a bad weld and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized an 85-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer interior and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to wipe the released product off the pallet. All UN1993-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040455
item.description:
Report E-2024040455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While pulling through the pumps to get to the drops the driver struck the bolster in front of the drops. The strike sheered off the loading heads for compartment three and five. This resulted in a diesel spill of approximately 35-40 gallons. CDG managed the spill cleanup. Product reached 2 storm drains. FD was on scene and reported the spill to the local VADEQ (VDEM-2024-03-02-0008).
